properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Westerly winds reaching near 90 kilometres per hour are expected beginning midday Friday. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-12T12:47:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-11T20:48:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1281258225.2021
Area: Grande-Vall√©e area, Sainte-Anne-des-Monts area, Anticosti
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions are possible beginning Saturday morning. Strong northerly winds are forecast to impact Naujaat beginning Saturday morning. These winds may cause significantly reduced visibilities in blowing snow Saturday morning and persisting through to Sunday. Please stay alert for updated bulletins and check local public forecasts for more information on timing and strength of winds. As the event draws nearer, this watch may be upgraded to a blizzard warning. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-13T01:19:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-12T09:20:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2545460047.2021
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A complex storm will affect the North Coast and Haida Gwaii tonight through Friday. A Pacific front will remain nearly stationary on a line from the North Coast to Haida Gwaii tonight through Friday. Heavy precipitation and strong winds will accompany this storm. Current model guidance suggests that Haida Gwaii and North Coast - coastal sections could receive significant snowfall Friday night. North Coast - inland including Stewart may see a prolonged period of snowfall Friday night through Saturday. South of the front, Terrace is expected to see heavy rainfall. Snowfall and rainfall amounts for this event are still being determined at the moment due to the uncertainty of the position of the front. Weather alerts may be issued at a later time as forecast confidence increases. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-12T15:36:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-11T23:37:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0930469477.2021
Area: Haida Gwaii, North Coast - coastal sections, North Coast - inland including Terrace, North Coast - inland including Stewart
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls could locally reduce visibilities to zero today. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for brief but intense bursts of heavy snow producing near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-13T02:02:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-12T10:03:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1131865381.2021
Area: La Sarre area, Amos area, Lebel-sur-Qu√©villon area, Senneterre area, Rouyn area, Malartic area, Val d'Or - Louvicourt area, Ville-Marie area, T√©miscaming area, Dorval Lodge area, Le Domaine area, Rapides-des-Joachims area, Fort William - Shawville area, Gouin Reservoir area, Parent area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions continue at Aklavik. Conditions will improve tonight. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-12T13:59:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-12T04:29:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3470893116.2021
Area: Aklavik Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Periods of brief but intense snowfall are expected. Visibilities will be rapidly reduced due to the heavy snow combined with blowing snow. Brief intense snowfall is expected this morning. An intense band of snow is currently moving eastward across the area. Visibilities will be rapidly reduced in heavy snow and blowing snow. Snow may accumulate rapidly on roads making travel hazardous. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-12T15:56:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-12T11:57:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2933825781.2021
Area: Kapuskasing - Hearst - Smooth Rock Falls, Timmins - Cochrane - Iroquois Falls
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Total snowfall: 20 to 30 cm by Saturday morning. Maximum wind gusts Friday: easterly up to 60 km/h . Maximum wind gusts Friday night: northerly up to 80 km/h Locations: Nain to Makkovik Time span: Beginning this morning and persisting into Saturday. Remarks: Snow and blowing snow will develop early this morning and then persist through Friday night and into Saturday. Near-zero visibilities in white-out conditions are expected at times. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-03-13T01:05:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-12T09:06:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2404121154.2021
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Total snowfall: 5 to 10 cm on Saturday with further amounts expected. Maximum wind gusts: northwesterly 80 km/h. Locations: Rigolet to Black Tickle. Time span: Saturday morning until overnight Sunday Remarks: Fresh snowfall will combine with strengthening northwesterly winds on Saturday to produce poor visibility in blowing snow. While strong winds will continue on Monday, the snow will taper off overnight Sunday night. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-03-13T01:04:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-12T09:05:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0884453291.2021
Area: Cartwright to Black Tickle, Rigolet and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A stalled Pacific front over the North Coast will give rain at times heavy to North Coast - inland including Kitimat tonight through Friday. Rainfall amounts near 50 mm can be expected by Friday evening before the rain eases. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-12T15:52:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-11T23:53:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4161900637.2021
Area: North Coast - inland including Kitimat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR SMITHERS AND BURNS LAKE (March 10, 2021 07:00 - Smithers) The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with the Northern Health Authority has issued a Dust Advisory for Smithers and Burns Lake because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation, dust suppression or a change in traffic patterns. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Exposure is particularly a concern for individuals with chronic conditions such as asthma, COPD, heart disease, and diabetes, respiratory infections such as COVID-19, pregnant women, infants, and older adults. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions or acute infections should postpone or reduce strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Where appropriate, maintain physical distancing. Anyone experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, should follow the advice of their health care provider. Staying indoors helps to reduce particulate matter exposure. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-03-12T20:57:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2021-03-12T04:58:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1884124238.2021
Area: Bulkley Valley, Lakes District
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Total snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 centimetres are expected by this evening. The snow combined with moderate winds will cause blowing snow which will significantly reduce visibilities. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-13T01:59:36-00:00

Area: LG Quatre - Laforge and Fontanges

Exposure is particularly a concern for individuals with chronic conditions such as asthma, COPD, heart disease, and diabetes, respiratory infections such as COVID-19, pregnant women, infants, and older adults.
